intro: Adelia leprosa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, thick leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming a low, compact rosette. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are adapted for pollination by insects. Adelia leprosa thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
